docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un looked forward to meeting with him, indicating the planned landmark talks between the isolated Asian leader and Republican president will go forward.

headline.print_headline: Trump Gives Positive Sign on Talks With Kim, Good Review of Xi Meeting
headline.main: Trump Gives Positive Sign on Talks With Kim, Good Review of Xi Meeting

docs.snippet: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is finalizing details for a summit with U.S. President Donald Trump on April 18 to discuss strategy before a proposed meeting between North Korean and U.S. leaders, a ruling party official told Reuters on Wednesd...

headline.print_headline: Japan PM Abe Likely to Meet President Trump on April 18: Source
headline.main: Japan PM Abe Likely to Meet President Trump on April 18: Source

docs.snippet: The Trump administration is expected to announce that it will roll back automobile gas mileage and pollution standards that were a pillar in the Obama administration's plans to combat climate change.

headline.print_headline: Trump EPA Expected to Roll Back Auto Gas Mileage Standards
headline.main: Trump EPA Expected to Roll Back Auto Gas Mileage Standards

docs.snippet: With a handshake and a presidential kiss on the cheek, Hope Hicks bid farewell to the White House, the press-shy communications director taking a rare moment in the spotlight on her final day in Donald Trump's administration.

headline.print_headline: Trump Loses a Trusted Aide, White House Anxiety Lingers
headline.main: Trump Loses a Trusted Aide, White House Anxiety Lingers

docs.snippet: An enigmatic North Korean leader takes a secretive train trip to China to affirm fraternal ties and declare a commitment to denuclearization.

headline.print_headline: Trump Is Hopeful, but Some Skeptical Ahead of US-NK Talks
headline.main: Trump Is Hopeful, but Some Skeptical Ahead of US-NK Talks

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump is seriously considering abandoning efforts to remake the nation's biofuel laws after wading deep into an issue that divides some of his core constituencies, according to three sources familiar with the administration's thin...

headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Trump Weighs Dropping Personal Efforts on Biofuel Reform-Sources
headline.main: Exclusive: Trump Weighs Dropping Personal Efforts on Biofuel Reform-Sources

docs.snippet: Still angry about the budget deal he signed last week, President Donald Trump has floated the idea of using the military's budget to pay for his long-promised border wall with Mexico, despite the fact that such spending would likely require approv...

headline.print_headline: Trump Floats Using Military Budget to Pay for Border Wall
headline.main: Trump Floats Using Military Budget to Pay for Border Wall

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump ousted Veterans Affairs Secretary David Shulkin on Wednesday in response to heavy criticism and nominated his personal physician, Rear Admiral Ronny Jackson, to replace him in the latest turnover among Trump's team.

headline.print_headline: Trump Pushes Out Shulkin at Veterans Affairs, Nominates Jackson as Replacement
headline.main: Trump Pushes Out Shulkin at Veterans Affairs, Nominates Jackson as Replacement
